descriptionNullable:
Dataset Description:

This dataset, named "Raw Data.csv," provides insights into various attributes related to students' academic experiences and demographics. The dataset appears to contain 39 columns, and the provided excerpt offers a glimpse into the types of data captured. Below is a summary of some of the key attributes included in the dataset:

Age: Age of the students, likely represented in ranges such as "18-22" and "23-26."
Gender: Gender of the students, categorized as "Male," "Female," and potentially "Other."
University: Names of universities attended by the students, with examples such as "Independent University, Bangladesh (IUB)" and "American International University Bangladesh (AIUB)."
Department: Academic departments or fields of study pursued by the students, including "Engineering - CS / CSE / CSC / Similar to CS" and "Business and Entrepreneurship Studies."
Academic Year: Current academic year or equivalent status, with categories like "First Year or Equivalent" and "Fourth Year or Equivalent."
Current CGPA: Cumulative Grade Point Average (CGPA) of the students, typically provided as numerical ranges.
Scholarship/Waiver: Indication of whether the students received financial assistance or waivers at their universities, with options like "true" and "false."
Academic Pressure Metrics: Insights into the frequency and impact of academic pressure on students, captured through questions like "In a semester, how often you felt nervous, anxious or on edge due to academic pressure?" and related responses.
Additionally, the dataset may contain other demographic and academic-related attributes, as well as labels or outcomes associated with students' performance or experiences.

**The dataset is sourced from Mendeley** and offers valuable insights into students' academic experiences and demographics. Researchers and analysts can use this dataset to explore various factors influencing students' academic performance, well-being, and success.
title: Bangladeshi University Students Mental Health
